ygData.subject: Re: Off-topic: Expending practice points
ygData.msgSnippet: When you learn the basics of xxxx it gives you 1 point per level. So when you learn the basics of something at 12th level one practice point gives you 12
ygData.messageBody:
When you "learn the basics of xxxx" it gives you 1 point per level. So when
you learn the basics of something at 12th level one practice point gives
you 12 skill.

Taelin, Songweavers of Kelethin








ReeceT@... on 05/04/99 10:40:30 PM

Please respond to eqbards@onelist.com








To: eqbards@onelist.com

cc: (bcc: Terry Chlebek/DPT)



Subject: [eqbards] Off-topic: Expending practice points









From: "Reece, Tom CPT - 30th Signal Bn" <ReeceT@...>

A general question about expending practice points:

When I got to 8th level I expended one practice point to train in String.
The first time I sang a song that used a stringed instrument, my skill
raised one point to 9. That indicates that expending the initial practice
point to get the String skill gave me a skill level of 8.

On the other hand, when I first started my character I expended one
practice point in Sense Heading. The next time I went up a level in Sense
Heading, my skill level was only 2. That indicated one practice point
spent and one skill level gained.

So, does expending a practice point give you a random amount of skill
levels based on your INT and/or WIS score or does it only give you one
skill level per practice point? If the second case is true, how do you
account for me getting 8 skill points in String while only expending 1
practice point?

Reason for asking: I am about to embark on a secondary career as the
Kelethin brewmaster for E'ci. I haven't expended any practice points in
brewing yet. I want to get my skill up to 10 before I start the learning
process. Just need to know if I only need to put a couple of practice
points in it or will I need to expend 10 practice points.

Thanks
Galtin
E'ci
